summary: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers stores water for municipal and industrial water users—such as local water utilities—in its reservoirs, dams, and other civil works projects. In return, water users agree to cover the costs of the project. Corps officials and water users told us that these project costs vary; but when we tried to examine to what extent, we found that the Corps' water...
title: Army Corps of Engineers: Better Data Needed on Water Storage Pricing
